page.title: 12Places of Worship-Merebrow.
page.content: In the block there are two places of worship both Methodist Chapels. Merebrow Chapel was built in 1902 of red brick and blue slates. It is quite a small chapel as Merebrow is a small village. Inside the chapel there are three rows of seats-two sides and the middle. Each seat is about 3 metres long in the middle and 2 metres at the sides. At the front of the chapel there is the pulpit where the preacher preaches. Behind the front of the chapel is a Vestry where the preacher and the organist wait for the service to begin. Half way through the service the children come out of the chapel and go into Sunday School for half an hour, then we go home. There is a service in the afternoon also but no Sunday School.
